description:
--PLEASE APPLY USING THE LINK BELOW

--PLEASE APPLY USING THE LINK BELOW



TWO MEN AND A TRUCK® Irwindale, CA is looking for motivated individuals who are looking to start their careers! We have immediate openings for Movers and Non-CDL Drivers. TWO MEN AND A TRUCK® offers great benefits, competitive pay (TIPS!), and opportunity within. Full-time / part-time schedules - flexible hours offered! 

Launch your career with TWO MEN AND A TRUCK® as a mover and discover the opportunities for growth into a driver position, office position or movement to other franchises. At TWO MEN AND A TRUCKÂ® your opportunities for growth are endless. More than one quarter of our franchise owners originally started as employees in our system!

As a mover, you will have a partner and together provide a world class customer service experience in the handling of each customer's possessions. This position provides a unique opportunity for those looking to combine general labor with their customer service talents.


Job Responsibilities


Provide exceptional customer service as you safely move, pack and unpack customer belongings
Greet customer upon arriving at the specified location and complete a walk-through of the premises
Communicate professionally in English, both verbally and in writing; comfortably interface with customer
Assist driver with truck inspections and moving equipment inventory
Share responsibility with the driver in accurately completing paperwork and payment collection

Job Requirements

Because moving is stressful, we seek candidates with a commitment to customer service and an appreciation for variety in your job!

High school diploma or equivalent
Excellent customer service skills
Professional attitude and demeanor
Experience in the fields of general labor, landscaping, construction or warehouse helpful
Strong logic and mathematical skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division using whole numbers and decimals. Ability to perform these operations using units of dollars, weight measurement, volume, distance and time)
Stamina to lift heavy items (100 lbs or more) repeatedly while climbing, balancing, kneeling, crouching, walking, etc.
Good hand-eye coordination
Valid driver's license and good driving record
Ability to pass a pre-employment drug test and background check

title: Groundskeeper
description:
The Groundskeeper will be responsible for performing ongoing landscaping tasks, as well as routine maintenance of all landscaping equipment.

Responsibilities

Mow lawns, prune bushes and trees, edge the walkways and give the grounds a manicured look
Take on special landscaping or planting projects as deemed necessary by the property manager
Collaborate with maintenance team to make sure the grounds and the building are always properly cared for
Remove trash and debris from streets, common areas, and vacant sites daily.
Empty trash cans in common areas and dispose of trash as needed.
Clean community common areas and workspaces including pool area, parking areas, BBQ areas,  and all maintenance areas.
Perform regular maintenance and minor repairs on the lawn care equipment and tools
Completes required paperwork.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

Must be 18 years of age or older
Knowledge of equipment and maintenance.
High school diploma/GED required
2+ years’ groundskeeping experience preferred
Must be a reliable worker who is able to perform routine tasks without supervision
Personal characteristics

Team oriented with an exceptionally strong work ethic and outstanding interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated analytical and organizational skills, problem-solving abilities, and attention to detail.
Poised and polished professional with excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong judgment and decision-making skills.

description:

* Experience in construction or landscape industry is preferred, but not necessary

* Punctual and dependable
* Ability to work effectively with individuals of differing backgrounds, knowledge and skill levels

title: Greenskeeper
description:
Greenskeeper

Reports to: Golf Course Superintendent, Assistant Superintendent and Maintenance Shop Supervisor
Classification: Non-exempt
Education and/or Experience
•	High school diploma or equivalent required.
•	Six months of experience in golf course gardening and landscaping preferred.

Job Knowledge, Core Competencies and Expectations
•	Knowledge of golf course and grounds operations.
•	Knowledge of irrigation systems.
•	Knowledge of and ability to perform required role in emergency situations.

Job Summary (Essential Functions)
Maintain golf course and landscaping around the course, clubhouse and other club facilities, including parking lots.

Job Tasks/Duties 
•	Plants and maintains ornamental shrubs, trees and turf.
•	Trims and feeds shrubs and trees; removes cuttings.
•	Maintains landscape beds around clubhouse and club grounds.
•	Operate and inspect equipment prior and after use and reports issues to the Maintenance Shop Supervisor
•	Rakes and blows leaves.
•	Prepares and applies fertilizers and pesticides.
•	Maintains and implements animal control systems.
•	Prepares soil plant beds, and establishes plantings by seed or transplants.
•	Maintains annual and perennial flowers in aesthetic arrangements.
•	Loads and unloads materials.
•	Empties garbage cans.
•	Attends staff meetings.
•	Performs other appropriate tasks assigned by the Golf Course Superintendent, Assistant Superintendent and Maintenance Shop Supervisor

Licenses and Special Requirements
•	Valid driver’s license.
•	Pesticide Applicator certificate (preferred) 

Physical Demands and Work Environment
•	Regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts and outside weather conditions.
•	Frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals.
•	Occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; high, precarious places; extreme cold; extreme heat; risk of electrical shock; and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.
•	Able to meet and perform the physical requirements and to work effectively in an environment which is typical of this position.
•	Frequent lifting (up to 50 pounds), bending, climbing, stooping, pulling, grasping, sitting, standing, reaching and walking
•	May need to use some protective equipment, such as a respirator, gloves, earplugs, eye guards/visors, boots and hat.

title: Maintenance Technician – Atria Collwood
description:
Maintenance Technician – Atria Collwood
To apply, go to 
Overview
What’s the difference between a job and a meaningful, rewarding career? The people you serve. When you work at Atria, you have a front-row seat to the amazing life stories of the wisest people on earth. What’s more, you are part of an extraordinary company – one that’s investing in the future of senior living by investing in you. Don’t just do a job. Be part of an extraordinary life.

Atria is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law. Atria will not tolerate harassment or discrimination based on any of these protected classifications.
Responsibilities
• Diagnose and repair problems in such areas as HVAC, electrical, plumbing, major appliances, carpentry, emergency systems, flooring, hardware accessories, masonry, painting/wallpaper, water features (pools, spas, etc.) and waste management systems.
• Complete assigned service requests and repairs consistent with company operating and equipment/supply standards and in a safe and timely manner.
• Perform turn-key work as required to ensure vacant apartment homes are rent-ready in a timely manner.
• Maintain customer service standards. Respond to resident requests and work with residents to minimize/resolve problems and complaints. Follow-through to ensure issue is resolved.
• Apply all applicable Atria Policies and Procedures such as, but not limited to, company operating and safety standards. Promote safe work practices among on-site staff.
• Ensure compliance with all federal, state and local laws, specifically Fair Housing regulations, building codes and environmental laws and regulations.
• Assist with organizing and prioritizing service requests and general maintenance tasks.
• May drive company vehicle from community to social and other various destinations (only if required by community).
• May supervise the work of other associates and outside contractors.
• May perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
• High School diploma or equivalent (GED) preferred.
• 1 year experience in property management maintenance performing the duties associated with a Maintenance Technician.
• Able to perform basic arithmetic skills such as measurement, addition, subtraction, multiplication and division in order to do basic calculations and analysis such as estimating, determining averages and percentages, and totals.
• Able to occasionally operate general office equipment such as, but not limited to, personal computer, telephone, photocopying machine, facsimile machine and postage machine.
• Able to frequently use general maintenance tools, supplies and equipment such as, but not limited to, hand tools, pressure washers, blowers, paint equipment, pool chemicals, ice removal equipment, ladders, landscaping equipment, sanders and safety equipment.
• Able to frequently handle and use chemicals and general cleaning supplies.
• Must possess basic hand tools necessary for performing maintenance related duties
• Position requires driving responsibilities (may use Company provided vehicle and/or personal vehicle).
• Must possess valid driver’s license.
• Must satisfactorily meet and be in compliance with Atria motor vehicle policy standards.
Maintenance Tech, Maintenance Technician, Facilities Technician, Property Maintenance, Maintenance Assistant, Porter, maintenance, HVAC, heat, ventilation, air conditioning, facilities

title: Landscaping Crew Member
description:
Landscape crew members are responsible for performing landscape maintenance on commercial and residential properties as directed by the Operation Manager. Hours are typically 40 per week, M-F. 

-Responsibilities include (but are not limited to) mowing, edging, weeding, raking, blowing, planting, pruning, gardening, etc.
-Ability to operate various mowing and finishing equipment, performing labor functions, mulching, installation, etc. 
-Previous industry experience, a willingness to deliver quality workmanship, and a strong work ethic
-Honest, dependable, have a positive attitude, and cooperative 
-Take care of equipment and tools, self-motivated, have a desire to learn and improve  
-Adheres to, and supports, company policies and seeks to grow with the company

Hourly wage depends on experience.

title: TRABAJADORES CON EXPERIENCIA EN CONSTRUCCIÓN DE LANDSCAPING
description:
Compañía especializada en diseño y construcción de landscaping en el norte del condado, solicita trabajadores para unirse a nuestro equipo.

El pago depende del nivel de experiencia y habilidades, a partir de los $16 dólares por hora.

Requisitos minimos:

1. Experiencia de trabajo en obra de construcción de landscaping. 
2. Facilidad de levanter hasta 90 libras.
3. Posibilidad de transportarse hasta nuestras instalaciones, el transporte al lugar de trabajo es por nuestra cuenta.
4. Adaptabilidad para trabajar tanto independientemente como en equipo.

Este trabajo es de tiempo complete y permanente, sin intervalos entre una obra y otra, se pagan días festivos y vacaciones, se proveerá de uniformes de trabajo.

Haga una cita llamando a Landscape Assistance al 760-740-1343.

***

A North County-based landscape design and build company is looking for laborers to join our crews.

Pay depends on skill level, and begins at $16/hour.

Minimum job requirements:
1. Experience working in landscape construction.
2. Ability to lift up to 90 lbs.
3. Reliable transportation to company location. Transportation to jobsite will be provided.
4. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

This position is a full time, permanent position with no downtime between jobs. Paid holidays and vacation. Uniform will be provided. 

Set up an appointment by contacting Landscape Assistance at 760-740-1343. Pay begins at $16 and depends on skill level. If applicant can back up a trailer and has a valid driver's license, an extra $1 per hour will be paid.

title: *Hiring Now!* Porter Needed @ Arbors Parc Rose( Essex)
description:
Enjoy your road to success! Essex Property Trust has an awesome company culture and is committed to the growth and advancement of its associates.

Some of the benefits Essex offers:
• Full medical, dental, and vision plans
• 401K Matching
• Housing Discount
• Wellness program with rewards and gym membership discounts

The person in this position is responsible for maintaining the grounds, curb appeal, clubhouse, amenities, and other common areas at one or more properties in order to assist preserving the asset and to provide a quality living environment for the residents. This position reports to the Maintenance Supervisor and/or Community Manager.

Key responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to the following:
- Performs daily property walks of tour route, pending move-in units and target units ensuring all areas are considered “market ready”
- Completes basic maintenance tasks including turnover cleaning, light landscaping, and painting with minimal supervision consistent with Company policy and direction from the Maintenance Supervisor, Community Manager and/or CMS
- Assists with administration of maintenance functions, e.g., tracking of inventory, maintaining updated records in relation to Pool Log, etc.
- Maintains the highest level of customer service for prospects, residents, vendors, and corporate departments
- Compliance with company standards as defined in the Human Resources Policy Manual, Operations Playbook and applicable laws, e.g., Fair Housing, Landlord Tenant, Local Building Codes, OSHA, and EEOC

Qualifications:
- High school diploma or equivalent, preferred
- Some custodial or general maintenance experience preferred
- Valid driver license and automobile insurance
- Ability to read and write English; speak English and understand spoken English
- General understanding of the Microsoft suite, property management software preferred

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
• May be exposed to constant activity that requires intermittent standing, bending, crouching, pushing/pulling, lifting/moving/carrying (light to heavy weight material/appliances/ equipment), climbing ladders/stairs, and walking on rooftops
• Requires manual dexterity sufficient to operate small-motorized equipment (i.e., repetitive hand/wrist, gripping and elbow motion)
• Must have normal range of hearing, vision, color discrimination and depth perception for proper operation of machines and equipment
• Requires the use of appropriate safety equipment (e.g., back belts, goggles, masks, gloves, etc.)

APPLY HERE:

title: Construction/Painting/Landscaping Laborer
description:
PLEASE CONTACT BY PHONE DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS (9AM-5PM)
OR TEXT YOUR NAME AND CONTACT DETAILS ANYTIME FOR A CALL BACK

We are a local full service general contractor specializing in updates and repairs to homes in preparation for sale of the property. We are expanding and are looking for hardworking individuals to join our team and provide various construction labor ranging from painting to landscaping.

Some construction experience is required but you do not need all of the listed skills. Desired skills include but are not limited to:
-Painting
-Concrete
-Masonry
-Carpentry
-Flooring
-Drywall
-Basic Electrical 
-Basic Plumbing

You must be coachable, interested in learning and improving skills, and have the intention of remaining with our company long-term. This is a full-time position with benefits, paid time off and holidays, and room for advancement.

REQUIREMENTS: 

-Excellent work ethic
-Physically capable of manual labor
-Honest, timely and reliable
-Reliable personal transportation
-Desire to build/create
-Willingness to take direction and learn new skills
-Able to comply with safety rules and jobsite best practices as instructed
-Works well with others
-Valid Driver’s License and clean DMV Record
-Be legally allowed to work in the US
-No felonies in the past 10 years
-No drug use

Pay Dependent on Experience.

PLEASE CONTACT BY PHONE DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS (9AM-5PM)
OR TEXT YOUR NAME AND CONTACT DETAILS ANYTIME FOR A CALL BACK
(8O5)450-5482

title: Need a laborer to assist foreman on a construction and landscaping job
description:
Looking for a laborer to assist my foreman. Must have basic English and a car as you will occasionally be going out to pick up parts. 

The job is a mixed bag, but its a lot of landscaping and irrigation related work, fencing, some digging (with shovels), occasional equipment operation (excavator, tractor, dump truck) that we will train you on if its the right fit. As the summer progresses the job will move more into construction labor as we start on the main house addition. 

Its a small crew and the property owner is often working with you, so we need someone who works hard, doesn’t complain and is reliable and easy to get along with. The job could be for up to 6 months, but for the first few weeks it will be one day at a time until we are sure its the right fit. 

The good parts of the Job are that the foreman is great, its almost always something new every day, and there is an opportunity to pick up a bunch of different skills.

title: Landscaping Assistant
description:
Apricot Lane Farms is a 214-acre Organic, Biodynamic, Regenerative Organic and Humane Certified farm.   We are looking for an experienced and responsible Landscaping Assistant to work on Apricot Lane Farms’ Landscaping needs while striving to maintain the principles of Biodynamic and Organic Farming. The primary responsibility of the Landscaping Assistant will be the cultivation and care of the landscaping and grounds throughout the farm. 

Job Responsibilities
•	Perform upkeep needs of various areas around the farm, including but not limited to, gates and call boxes at 
        main entrances, as well in and around farm buildings
•	Monitor irrigation of plant/trees to ensure sufficient watering
•	Performance of daily task, including but not limited to, dead-head plants, pruning, and mulching, planting, 
        mowing, weed whacking, blowing, trimming, trenching, digging, trash clearing and hand weeding
•	Planting, replanting, pruning, treating diseased plants and trees, gopher trapping as needed, seeding and seed 
        collection, transplants, etc.
•	Works Habitat team (under direction of management) for Habitat and Landscape needs

Requirements:
•	Professional and positive attitude
•	Able to operate power blowers, string trimmers and 21” mowers (REQUIRED)
•	Ability to lift and carry a minimum of 35 pounds.
•	Able/willing to work in a variety of weather conditions – rain, heat, heavy winds, etc.
•	Ability to work in fast-pace environment
•	Must be able to follow directions and follow-through

Qualifications
•	Minimum of 2 years of landscaping experience
•	Irrigation Experience (preferred)
•	Knowledge of California Native and a wide range of plants including annuals, perennials, 
        shrubs, and trees (Preferred)
•	Ability to effectively communicate clearly with team, co-workers, management, and vendors.
•	For safety purposes, the ability to swim is a must
•	Process and detail-oriented

Schedule:
Monday – Friday 6:30 am to 3:00pm
Weekends and evening hours may be necessary during emergencies. 

Benefits
•	Excellent health benefits package, Paid Sick Leave, Paid Vacation, Paid Farm Holidays, 401K, 401K Matching, Flexible Spending Account, Employee Discounts

title: Landscaping Labor
description:
We are building some retaining walls on the slope in the backyard.  We need someone to bring the blocks (each weighs over 60lbs) from the driveway into the backyard and down the slope and stack them neatly in stacks in specific areas.  Total distance is about 100 yards, 20 yard are down the slope which does have stairs most of the way.  We plan to need over 1000 blocks for the job.  350 blocks will be arriving any day for the first phase.  We are paying $1 per block moved to the slope.  If you can do it in a day, that is $350 cash that day.

A face mask must be worn at all times.  If you have been vaccinated, please let us know in your response and please attach a current pic of yourself along with a resume and cover letter to be considered for the position.  You must be in excellent physical condition.  

Thank you!

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Didn’t know that self-storage could be a fun and rewarding career? At Hollywood Storage Center of Thousand Oaks, we take pride in working as a team, helping our customers, and making a difference in our community. We always hear the same thing when people walk in our door – “I’ve never seen a storage place like this!” And, this makes us happy!

Right now, we’re looking for a Maintenance Technician with a positive attitude and friendly demeanor to join our team. This is a full-time, permanent position and includes weekends. (We’re open seven days a week to provide great service to our customers.)

The position pays at a starting rate of $18 / hour, with the opportunity to earn a substantial year end bonus.

Compensation includes hourly pay and bonus.

There are also benefits such as fully-paid HMO Medical Coverage (with option for PPO), Paid Time Off, Medical and Childcare Reimbursement Plans, Life Insurance & more.

The winning candidate will have:

Excellent verbal communication skills in the English language
Minimum of high school diploma or equivalent
To apply, please include your resume AND write the words “I’m perfect for Hollywood Storage” in your submission.
Additionally applicants must be 23+ with clean DMV. Must be able/willing to work week-ends and have a valid driver's license.
Tasks will include janitorial work, repair and maintenance of buildings and landscaping, local pick-up and deliveries with 16’ box truck, and excellent customer service.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $18.00 per hour

title: Greenskeeper
description:
Greenskeeper - Must have experience in Chemical & Fertilizer Applications
Related Titles: Greenskeeper
Reports to: Golf Course Superintendent 
Supervises: No supervisory duties are included in this position.
Classification: 
Education and/or Experience
•	Some High School.
•	Experience in golf course grounds, 1+ years.

Job Knowledge, Core Competencies and Expectations
•	Knowledge of golf course operations.
•	Knowledge of irrigation systems.
•	Knowledge of and ability to perform required role in emergency situations.

Job Summary (Essential Functions)
Maintain golf course and landscaping around the course, clubhouse and other club facilities, including parking lots.

Job Tasks/Duties (included, but not limited to)
•	Plants and maintains ornamental shrubs and trees.
•	Trims and feeds shrubs and trees; removes cuttings.
•	Maintains landscape beds around clubhouse and club grounds.
•	Rakes and blows leaves.
•	Mows greens and fairways by operating walk-behind turf equipment.
•	Prepares and lays sod.
•	Prepares soil plant beds, and establishes plantings by seed or transplants.
•	Maintains annual and perennial flowers in aesthetic arrangements.
•	Rakes bunkers.
•	Loads and unloads materials.
•	Repairs and maintains driving range tees.
•	Cleans equipment used in practice area.
•	Aerifies and spikes greens.
•	Digs holes and trenches to maintain or construct irrigation and drainage lines.
•	Installs pipe and backfills excavations.
•	Empties garbage cans.
•	Attends staff meetings.
•	Performs other appropriate tasks assigned by the Golf Course Maintenance Foreman.
Licenses and Special Requirements
•	Valid driver’s license.

Physical Demands and Work Environment
•	Regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts and outside weather conditions.
•	Frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals.
•	Occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; high, precarious places; extreme cold; extreme heat; risk of electrical shock; and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.
•	Able to meet and perform the physical requirements and to work effectively in an environment which is typical of this position.
•	Frequent lifting up to 75 pounds, bending, climbing, stooping and pulling. 
•	May need to use some protective equipment, such as a respirator, gloves, earplugs, eye guards/visors, boots and hat.

The person in this position is responsible for maintaining the grounds, curb appeal, clubhouse, amenities, and other common areas at one or more properties in order to assist preserving the asset and to provide a quality living environment for the residents. This position reports to the Maintenance Supervisor and/or Community Manager.

Key responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to the following:
- Performs daily property walks of tour route, pending move-in units and target units ensuring all areas are considered “market ready”
- Completes basic maintenance tasks including turnover cleaning, light landscaping, and painting with minimal supervision consistent with Company policy and direction from the Maintenance Supervisor, Community Manager and/or CMS
- Assists with administration of maintenance functions, e.g., tracking of inventory, maintaining updated records in relation to Pool Log, etc.
- Maintains the highest level of customer service for prospects, residents, vendors, and corporate departments
- Compliance with company standards as defined in the Human Resources Policy Manual, Operations Playbook and applicable laws, e.g., Fair Housing, Landlord Tenant, Local Building Codes, OSHA, and EEOC

Qualifications:
- High school diploma or equivalent, preferred
- Some custodial or general maintenance experience preferred
- Valid driver license and automobile insurance
- Ability to read and write English; speak English and understand spoken English
- General understanding of the Microsoft suite, property management software preferred

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
• May be exposed to constant activity that requires intermittent standing, bending, crouching, pushing/pulling, lifting/moving/carrying (light to heavy weight material/appliances/ equipment), climbing ladders/stairs, and walking on rooftops
• Requires manual dexterity sufficient to operate small-motorized equipment (i.e., repetitive hand/wrist, gripping and elbow motion)
• Must have normal range of hearing, vision, color discrimination and depth perception for proper operation of machines and equipment
• Requires the use of appropriate safety equipment (e.g., back belts, goggles, masks, gloves, etc.)

title: Personal Assistant
description:
Position Description:
We are looking for a personal/executive assistant for the owner of a Los Angeles based company that operates in in the real estate development business.  As an integral part of the daily operations, this position will be responsible for managing all vendor relations for various properties.  This includes but not limited to detailed vendor scheduling and communication, running general errands, and all associated daily tasks for the owner’s family.  Some weekend and evening work may be required.

General Outline of Duties
•	Assist with all relevant tasks related to the real estate development/management company (i.e. obtaining quotes for labor/materials, following up with various subcontractors on scheduling and attendance, calling vendors for materials pricing and availability, procuring and purchasing necessary items, interacting with the interior design agency as needed, etc.).
•	Run general errands.
•	Organize and verify schedule.
•	Coordinate any and all maintenance issues that arise (i.e. landscaping, AC, pool, etc.) on all properties.
•	Schedule and manage travel plans.
•	Coordinate and schedule the maintenance of owner and family’s vehicles.

Position Requirements
•	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
•	High school diploma or equivalent.
•	Excellent phone presence as well as written and verbal communication skills.
•	Proficiency in PC operating systems and their tools.
•	Ability to be discreet and private with all family information.
•	References (preferred).
•	Required detailed background check.
•	Clean driving record with reliable transportation, with valid driver’s license and insurance.

Position Location:
This position requires to work from both the Chatsworth, CA office and out in the field (mostly in the San Fernando Valley Area).  As this position requires onsite property visits (mostly in the San Fernando Valley Area), a car with valid insurance is necessary.  It is preferable for the candidate to reside within a 30 minute commute of Chatsworth, CA.

title: Landscape Designer
description:
Pacific Outdoor Living is an award winning outdoor landscape design-build company. We install landscapes, swimming pools and all outdoor construction elements, for residential. We are currently seeking additional landscape designers to become part of our team.

The ideal candidate must be passionate about landscaping and enthusiastic about design, and in seeing their designs come to fruition. He or she should be reliable, accountable and demonstrate dependability, presenting a professional demeanor and appearance while communicating effectively with clients. Preference is given to those who use AutoCAD, and have previous experience selling their own landscape designs to homeowners.

Position benefits:

1) Leads are qualified and appointments are set for you, and an abundance of projects for each designer 2) We provide a fully staffed Estimating Department including: CAD Operator, a Site Measurer, Permit Coordinator, Chief Estimator 3) Initial training of our internal systems and contracts is provided. 4) In-house crews including demolition, hardscape, softscape and masons, along with project managers, to install each of your landscape designs at a high quality.

This is an employee position, with a base pay plus commissions for sold landscape projects. All landscape designers are also eligible to earn weekly and quarterly bonuses. Pay range listed includes base salary, average on commissions and production bonuses.

The Landscape Designer will be assisting in the development of the project design, site plans, specifications, presentation of drawings, sketches, and assisting in solving design complexities. This individual must demonstrate creativity and good design judgement. Construction knowledge is a must. They will also be involved in the final estimate being put together and responsible for presenting the estimate, along with the final landscape design plan, to the home owner, and closing the sale in order to move ahead on the construction.

Qualifications:

- 5+ years experience as a Landscape Designer
- Can provide a portfolio including design work and before and after photos of projects
- Experience selling your own designs and in-home sales experience
- Can meet with clients for in-home appointments
- Can commute to our main office in Sun Valley
- Knowledge of LOCAL plants - "Southern California plant palette knowledge"
- Knowledge of horticultural science and construction techniques a PLUS
- Proficient in Microsoft Office, AutoCAD, SketchUp, and Lumion
- Experience developing various plans from conception to completion

Salary and Benefits:

- Introductory training
- Base pay plus commissions
- Medical and Dental benefits
- Retirement Plan
- Mileage reimbursement
- Weekly and monthly bonuses

Please be prepared to take a few knowledge tests and provide a portfolio during initial interview.

To see some of our work please visit our website at www.pacificoutdoorliving.com.

Entry Level Sales Openings - Work From Home
description:
Entry level sales openings --  -- work with customers virtually explaining our products.  There is no cost to start. Great for friendly people with or without customer experience, we will train you. Our company promotes from within, making it easy to grow with the company in a short amount of time. 


The pay starts at $22.00 base-appt.  Let me be clear on this point: that is a flat rate, not based on sales or commissions. Some conditions apply.  Unfortunately there are no benefits as this is an entry level position. Most people start with ZERO experience.  New team members always say our simple, fun training gives them all the confidence they need.  We look for people that want to improve their resume and communication skills, not just those who want to make money (we DO offer pay-raises for top performers).  Hours are 100% flexible: days/evenings/weekends/part time/& more.


We are looking for applicants who enjoy working with people, willing to learn and apply new skills. All ages eighteen and up. Those who have done well with us have had all kinds of work experience (some none at all!) - customer service; retail; office work; receptionist; sales rep; cashier; fast food; barista; stocked shelves at a supermarket; college student; server; freelance worker; intern; salesperson; babysitter or nanny; communications; administrative assistant; admin work; student work; landscaping; dog walking… Our training is so good even if an applicant has no experience at all, they can do well here. Since the position involves working with people 98.6% of students say their communication skills improve while working with us. So, even though experience isn’t necessary, we do look for people who are comfortable working with others.





Once we receive your contact information, a receptionist will send you a text to set up a time to talk with the manager. We find that this is a lot easier and faster for our applicants (since everybody always has their phones on them). We encourage applicants of all ages and experience, as we do not discriminate on the basis of an applicant’s age.

description:
Location: Malibu (near Point Dume)

Schedule: General Hours at the house are 9am – 4pm, on call as needed via email/phone

Compensation: 100K – 185K DOE plus stipend towards benefits

Seeking an experienced House Manager / Personal Assistant to support a well established couple in Malibu. While the role is vast, and does require someone who has experience in all areas of the position, there is help in terms of runners (that can be hired as well), travel agents etc.  You will be responsible for all “home based” needs and interfacing daily with executive assistants in their businesses. Additionally there is a housekeeper that comes a few times a week.

Day to Day Home Needs:

Managing household – repair (things break at least once a week, locks, heaters, lights, appliances, internet, coordinating fixes with (leasing agent) & managing vendors on site
Stocking home of groceries (Instacart, runner or chef also assists) and household supplies.
Ensuring house is in good appearance when HSKP is not present.
Managing automobiles – cars are always up to date, charged, fueled, cleaned
Managing guests – preparing all guest rooms, guest schedule, guest preferences, assuring guests have everything the need
Managing florals – weekly deliveries, keeping flowers fresh in the house
Managing all incoming and outgoing packages – keeping log of everything that arrives, putting away or unboxing packages and setting aside for later or after work.
Misc house updates (occasional) – coordinating furniture changes, new decor, updates
Managing storage spaces – assuring all storage areas, extra freezers, etc. are kept tidy
Managing all meals – coffee refills, lunch, snacks during the day, coordinating weekly dinners and food for fridge with chef
Managing all reservations – special relationships with best restaurants in LA in order to secure reservations in short notice at prime times
Taking care of dog and cat – play dates with dog walker, weekly groomer or bathing, always restocking fridge & pantry with new food, vet appointments
Misc requests during the day – chargers, last minute gifts, errands, requested items, etc.
Weekly appointments – pool cleaning, weekly cleaners, weekly landscaping
Overseeing and updating lease agreement
 

Assistant Requirements 

All travel – planning & proposing trips, securing locations, flights, sending preferences to hotel, coordination of drivers, private planes, activities, etc.
All gifts – monthly gifting to friends and family – this is very important to them
Household parties, dinner and entertaining – planning & proposing dinners, working with chefs on menus, planners when necessary, assuring home has all required items
All medical – coordinating dental, therapy, general practitioner, holistic medicine, acupuncture, massage, etc. appointments. overseeing insurance payments to ensure all is being tracked. keeping on top of follow up appointments
Wardrobe – both have nice clothing, taking care of clothes and keeping closet organized
Jewelry – Client has a lot of jewelry that needs to continually be catalogued, insured, and maintained
Financial management – potential to expand here as well
Calendaring – working with executive assistants to ensure all scheduled appointments and travel are coordinated with work schedules
 

Position Requirements:

Hyper detail oriented and organized
Calm demeanor and easy to be around (since this person will be working from the house day to day)
Effective communication – understands how to be concise, direct, and timely. Efficient in follow up and prioritization of items that require immediate attention
Established network in Los Angeles (bonus for New York & Europe)
Experiencing working with luxury clientele and understanding of the ‘best of’ all things (food, restaurants, chefs, travel locations, brands, gifts, interiors, jewelry, art, healers)
Forward thinking – is able to foresee issues before they happen
Excellent producer – very process oriented, structured
15+ years experience, should be at least 30 – 35
Position Logistics: 

Available to respond to requests at any time including weekend
In close proximity to Malibu (west LA or valley)
Salary / Benefits: 

100K- 185K DOE
Car Stipend –mileage and usage
Health Stipend
Start Date: 

Mid May 2021
Train with current out going assistant till until 6/11

title: Winery Groundskeeper **Needed ASAP**
description:
The Groundskeeper will maintain landscaping at all Ponte properties and ensures that the property is presented with a quality that exceeds the guest’s expectations.


•	Understands and adheres to the Ponte values and service standards.
•	Ensure the safety of guests and associates.
•	Ensure that trash is removed from the facility and grounds.
•	Communicate clearly with coworkers and leadership team any concerns, pass downs or follow up information.
•	Mow or edge lawns, using power mowers or edger.
•	Care for established lawns by mulching, aerating, weeding, grubbing, removing thatch, or trimming or edging around flower beds, walks, or walls.
•	Use hand tools, such as shovels, rakes, pruning saws, saws, hedge or brush trimmers, or axes.
•	Prune or trim trees, shrubs, or hedges, using shears, pruners, or chain saws.
•	Mix and spray or spread fertilizers, herbicides, or insecticides onto grass, shrubs, or trees, using hand or automatic sprayers or spreaders.
•	Water lawns, trees, or plants, using portable sprinkler systems, hoses, or watering cans.

•	Rake, mulch, and compost leaves.
•	Follow planned landscaping designs to determine where to lay sod, sow grass, or plant flowers or foliage.

•	The associate must frequently lift, move, push or pull up to 50 pounds.

•	Wednesday-Sunday, but flexible with schedule

•	32-40 hours

title: **Property Manager- Commercial*Light Industrial/Office*Benefits!
description:
The Ezralow Company, LLC is a privately-owned company that thrives for creativity, where innovation is rewarded. We specialize in acquiring, developing and management of commercial and multi-family housing properties. If you are looking for a rewarding career with a proven career path, The Ezralow Company is the place for you!

Who we are looking for and the contributions you will provide:

We are seeking an established professional Commercial Property Manager who will partner with our Regional Property Supervisor to handle all phases of our property operations. This is a hands-on position that involves day-to-day management. You will work in our Rancho Cucamonga office.

Our ideal candidate

As the Property Manager, you will create and maintain a professional level of operation and cultivate positive relationships with tenants through excellent customer service and fair resolution of issues pertaining to operations and accounting.
Market and lease the property, qualifying and showing space to prospective tenants and negotiating new leases and lease renewals. Coordinate tenant move-ins and move-outs and "walk-through" spaces with tenants and handle all tenant improvements.
Create lease abstracts, prepare leases and enter tenant/lease information into property management system.
Establish scope of work, solicit bids and issue contracts for routine services including roof maintenance, HVAC and plumbing maintenance, fire protection and life safety systems and landscaping.
Take tenant maintenance telephone calls and coordinate vendor responses. Verify completeness.
Oversee capital projects including the bidding process, awarding contracts, scheduling work and overseeing progress throughout the project. Coordinate contracts with corporate contract administrator.
Prepare monthly operating status reports to include operations, tenant delinquencies, explanations of significant variances to operating budgets, capital, tenant improvements and market comps.
Prepare annual operating budgets, including leasing assumptions, expenses and capital expenditures.
Maintain insurance certificates for all tenants and vendors.
Conduct site inspections with vendors to ensure satisfaction with services being performed.
Acts as primary contact with property owners to ensure that objectives as being met.
What you bring
Hands-on professional with a keen eye for detail, great people skills and the ability to prioritize activities and work independently. Specific qualifications include:

College degree in real estate, business or related field.
Five or more years’ experience in commercial real estate.
Certified Property Management (CPM) designation a plus.
Strong understanding of financial reports, including variance of actual vs. budget numbers.
Good working knowledge of building systems. Experience with “make ready” and tenant improvement projects a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated experience with real estate software such as Yardi.
Benefits of working for The Ezralow Company, LLC

Welcome to The Ezralow Company, LLC an inspiring place to work. Our company has longevity in the property management industry with forward thinking ideas. The company culture encourages employee ideas with creative innovations. We have a dynamic atmosphere that welcomes diversity and we are investing in our employees, along with the growth of our company.

We encourage a vibrant and fun work environment, growth opportunities and a generous benefits package, which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Life and additional supplemental insurance benefits. (Work hard, Play harder!) Paid vacation, sick and holiday time. If you are looking for a rewarding career with a proven career path and a fun working environment, this is the place for you!

description:
With a busy year ahead, you could benefit from a part time position that pays weekly and allows you to work from home. We provide the flexibility to work around any schedule.  Our entry level sales and service positions offer useful real world work experience and are a great addition to any person’s resume.


Basic positions in customer sales and service. Primary responsibilities include working with customers virtually, answering questions, and writing up any orders. There is no experience needed to apply, we provide all of the training. There isn’t any cold calling and there is no cost to start. The starting pay rate is $22.00 guaranteed base/appt,  but there is an opportunity to make more based on performance with our company. We provide flexible schedules for all members. Since reps have an opportunity to set their own schedule, some work part time, some work as much as possible, and some just work a few hours a week to earn some extra income around classes or other commitments.

We are looking to fill positions  (1st applied, 1st considered basis).

 

Once we receive your contact information a receptionist will follow up with you via text to set up a virtual interview with the manager. We find that this is a lot easier and faster for our applicants (since everybody always has their phones on them).


  
We encourage applicants of all ages and experience, as we do not discriminate on the basis of an applicant’s age. We are looking for applicants who enjoy working with people, willing to learn and apply new skills. All ages eighteen and up or seventeen and a high school graduate. Working at Vector is great for those who are looking for a flexible work opportunity. Part time openings with an option to go full time. Those who have done well with us have had all kinds of work experience (some none at all!) - customer service; retail; office work; receptionist; sales rep; cashier; fast food; barista; stocked shelves at a supermarket; in a call center (which we don’t do by the way); telemarketing; entry level or temp work; college student; contractors; data entry; host or restaurant work; freelance worker; intern; salesperson; babysitter or nanny; communications; administrative assistant; admin work; student work; work from home; remote work; landscaping; dog walking… Our training is so good even if an applicant has no experience at all, they can do well here.

title: Maintenance Tech (Facilities Manager)
description:
Job Title:  Maintenance Tech			             		                   Status: Hourly, Non-exempt
Reports to: VP of HR and Executive Assistant	                                 Department Name: Administration	

MAD Engine Global is seeking an experienced Maintenance Technician to support the company’s facilities, equipment and overall operation of the business.  In this position, your main responsibility is to preserve the condition and functionality of the business premises. Your duties will include conducting assessments, scheduling repairs, maintaining inventory, and developing preventative maintenance procedures.  The ideal candidate will have a wide range of skills and experience, with in-depth knowledge of maintenance procedures, basic tools and equipment. To succeed in this position, you must be an outstanding problem-solver with exceptional communication and organizational skills.
Essential Duties and responsibilities
•	Inspect buildings, equipment, and systems to identify issues.
•	Maintain heating and air, plumbing and electrical systems, perform basic repairs
•	Plan and schedule periodic maintenance
•	Coordinate with outside contractors, as required for more complicated repairs
•	Perform general maintenance tasks including landscaping, painting, and carpentry.
•	Maintain the inventory records for equipment and supplies.
•	Perform other duties as needed to support the company’s operations
•	Ensure the facility if clean and maintained
•	Deal with building emergencies as they arise
•	Manage hazardous waste disposal program
•	Communicate any maintenance problems or health/safety deficiencies to management
•	Other duties assigned as needed

Minimum Qualifications
•	High school diploma or equivalent
•	Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar role.
•	Basic knowledge of heating & air, plumbing and electrical systems
•	Advanced understanding of general maintenance procedures and techniques.
•	Physically capable and available to work outside normal working hours if needed
•	Effective problem-solving abilities.
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
•	Must be well- organized and have the ability to prioritize tasks
•	Strong working knowledge of MS Office: Email, basic Excel
•	Must be well organized and a self-starter
•	Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
•	Ability to work with a sense of pride and urgency and to adapt and be flexible as priorities change

Requirements
•	Must be well organized and a self-starter
•	Strong attention to detail.
•	Good organizational and time-management skills.
•	Great interpersonal and communication skills. 
•	Must be well- organized and have the ability to prioritize tasks
•	Strong working knowledge of MS Office: Email, basic Excel

Physical Requirements
•	Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment
•	Casual office attire
•	Sit, stand, bend, stoop, occasional to frequent lifting
•	Ability to listen and speak with employees and customers
•	Occasionally lift up to 45 pounds
•	View and type on computer screens 

Working Conditions
•	Work is performed inside a temperature-controlled office building

title: **Property Manager- Commercial*Light Industrial/Office*Benefits!
description:
The Ezralow Company, LLC is a privately-owned company that thrives for creativity, where innovation is rewarded. We specialize in acquiring, developing and management of commercial and multi-family housing properties. If you are looking for a rewarding career with a proven career path, The Ezralow Company is the place for you!

Who we are looking for and the contributions you will provide:

We are seeking an established professional Commercial Property Manager who will partner with our Regional Property Supervisor to handle all phases of our property operations. This is a hands-on position that involves day-to-day management. You will work in our Rancho Cucamonga office.

Our ideal candidate

As the Property Manager, you will create and maintain a professional level of operation and cultivate positive relationships with tenants through excellent customer service and fair resolution of issues pertaining to operations and accounting.
Market and lease the property, qualifying and showing space to prospective tenants and negotiating new leases and lease renewals. Coordinate tenant move-ins and move-outs and "walk-through" spaces with tenants and handle all tenant improvements.
Create lease abstracts, prepare leases and enter tenant/lease information into property management system.
Establish scope of work, solicit bids and issue contracts for routine services including roof maintenance, HVAC and plumbing maintenance, fire protection and life safety systems and landscaping.
Take tenant maintenance telephone calls and coordinate vendor responses. Verify completeness.
Oversee capital projects including the bidding process, awarding contracts, scheduling work and overseeing progress throughout the project. Coordinate contracts with corporate contract administrator.
Prepare monthly operating status reports to include operations, tenant delinquencies, explanations of significant variances to operating budgets, capital, tenant improvements and market comps.
Prepare annual operating budgets, including leasing assumptions, expenses and capital expenditures.
Maintain insurance certificates for all tenants and vendors.
Conduct site inspections with vendors to ensure satisfaction with services being performed.
Acts as primary contact with property owners to ensure that objectives as being met.
What you bring
Hands-on professional with a keen eye for detail, great people skills and the ability to prioritize activities and work independently. Specific qualifications include:

College degree in real estate, business or related field.
Five or more years’ experience in commercial real estate.
Certified Property Management (CPM) designation a plus.
Strong understanding of financial reports, including variance of actual vs. budget numbers.
Good working knowledge of building systems. Experience with “make ready” and tenant improvement projects a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated experience with real estate software such as Yardi.
Benefits of working for The Ezralow Company, LLC

Welcome to The Ezralow Company, LLC an inspiring place to work. Our company has longevity in the property management industry with forward thinking ideas. The company culture encourages employee ideas with creative innovations. We have a dynamic atmosphere that welcomes diversity and we are investing in our employees, along with the growth of our company.

We encourage a vibrant and fun work environment, growth opportunities and a generous benefits package, which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Life and additional supplemental insurance benefits. (Work hard, Play harder!) Paid vacation, sick and holiday time. If you are looking for a rewarding career with a proven career path and a fun working environment, this is the place for you!

Submit your application/resume through this link:

title: Experienced Construction Labor
description:
**Immediate Start**
Our Company is looking for motivated high energy individuals to work in general construction for house remodeling and apartment remodeling. We are looking for individuals with excellent communication skills, 5 YEARS EXPERIENCE in painting, general handyman trade, or construction trade required. Should know how to paint, hang drywall, mud, spray texture, plumbing and electrical for remodeling, framing, cement work, brick work, and yard work. A willingness to learn is mandatory.

Must be legal to work in the US and have valid DL. Will require reliable transportation as job requires different job sites daily. Properties are located in Riverside and Temecula Valley, Orange County. Hours are 730 to 430 Monday through Friday. Looking for reliable, honest, team players for a fast moving remodeling company.

We remodel home interiors, paint interior and exteriors, remodel bathrooms and kitchens, replace wood flooring, laminate and tile flooring. We also renovate landscaping, fencing, roofing, plumbing, and electrical. We already have specialty vendors we work with and are looking for construction labor to assist with projects.

*Must be mechanical, neat, organized, and have a good memory, should be able to work independently.
*Must be able and willing to do manual labor. Standing, sitting, digging, working outdoors are common depending on the project.
*Basic knowledge of construction tools and how to use them properly and safely.
*Working closely with foreman to keep the job on track and implement
quality control.
*Required that individual have some construction tools such as hammer, screw drivers, and some power tools.

About our company, we are a real estate investment company currently purchasing homes to renovate in Riverside County and Orange County. We have been in business for over 30 years and have a crew of about 10 people that is family run. We would like team players to welcome to our company. Job is full time or part time.

Please send a short email with your contact info and why you think you will fit in our team and we will respond. Please include work experience. Compensation is $22 hr or more DOE.

description:
The Winery Housekeeper will help clean the facility and the grounds and ensure that the property is presented with a quality that exceeds the guest’s expectations.

•	Assist with folding clean linens.
•	Fold table cloths and napkins in the Laundry Room. 
•	Apply stain remover to 200 to 300 napkins a day. 
•	While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to stand, walk, and use hands and fingers for long periods of time during the shift. 
•	The associate must frequently lift, move, push or pull up to 15 lbs. or less. 
•	Ability to work in cold and warm outdoor temperatures.
•	Maintain cleanliness and inventory of storage areas reporting any deficiencies to Housekeeping Manager. 
•	Understand and adhere to the environmental standards set by the winery.
•	Understands and adheres to the Ponte values and service standards.
•	Ensure the safety of guests and associates.
•	Perform any additional duties as requested by Housekeeping Supervisor.


•	Ability to treat all associates and guests in a respectful manner.
•	Exhibits integrity (honesty and truthfulness).
•	Has attention to detail.
•	Is consistently striving to be better.


•	Wednesday - Sunday 
•	10:30am – 7:00pm
•	32-40 hrs. a week

title: General Laborer (Independent Contractors)
description:
We are looking for Independent Contractors in Riverside County. Drive to locations, bring lunch, work hard from start to finish. Must be responsible and reliable. Pay starts at $15. 

📌 Junk Removal and Cleanouts:
- pick-up light to heavy items such as trash, furniture, appliances, green waste, concrete, metal, non-hazardous materials
- garage, house, storage unit cleanouts, etc.

- concrete demo

- weed pulling/abatement
- removing mulch, dirt, gravel, planting, etc.
- spreading rocks, mulch, etc.

- moving/loading dirt, rock, concrete, trash
- leveling
- use of attachments such as mower deck and breaker


⭐ General laborer are contractor 1099 positions. You are responsible as a contractor to communicate with us to see when work is available to you, show up to job sites on your own, perform contracted work according to Job Plan, tracking your own time and producing your own invoices. Payment provided upon satisfactory completion of job determined by Management. We will ensure everything our clients want is in the Job plan ahead of job start. You will be responsible for your own health and safety, and any damages caused in the performance of your work for each project you accept. 

✅ Independent Contractor Requirements
- Must bring own PPE (gloves, safety glasses, dust masks, etc.)
- Reliable, Honest, willing to work hard
- Heavy lifting
- No prior injuries or ailments as this job requires heavy lifting and constant moving
- Must be able to work in outdoor environment (hot or cold)
- Must speak English
- Must be able to legally work in the US
- Bring own work boots, safety glasses and gloves to work everyday
- Must have own transportation to meet us at job site (varies everyday throughout Riverside County)
- Be respectful to clients
- Be respectful of other’s property
- Reliable cell phone to communicate schedule and job locations

✅ Additional Driver Requirements
- Clean driving record
- Must have experience driving utility trailer/dump trailer
- Will be compensated more if you drive your own truck

DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT MEET THE ABOVE REQUIREMENTS

Potential Hours:
Sunday – Friday (no Saturdays); 7AM – 5PM
Part-time on call to full time. 

FOR CONSIDERATION
Reply with your full name, phone number, your city and work experience. 
Specify your desired pay and available days/hrs.
Resumes are highly encouraged.

Calls are welcome but, those who submit the info above to my email will be considered first. So please submit the info to me if you are going to call.

title: Full Time Greenkeeper I (landscaper) - Private Golf Club
description:
LOOKING FOR A GREAT OPPORTUNITY!?!

Shady Canyon Golf Club is one of the premier clubs in Southern California, located in Irvine. Tom Fazio designed a challenging golf course laid out over 300 acres in a natural setting. The course was established in 2002, and shortly thereafter received Audubon certification. Shady Canyon is a private club offering Golf and Social memberships. Member dining is available six days a week. Members can choose to dine in the Talon Room and Bar, Men's Grill or Ladies' Grill. We also offer a Golf Snack Bar and a seasonal Pool Snack Bar. Banquet rooms are available for private parties. A Fitness Center with Pool and Spa facilities is open seven days a week. If you are interested in joining our family please continue reading...

Our Full Time positions offer a rich benefit's package including medical, dental, vision, 401k as well as paid vacation, sick time and much more!

Shady Canyon Golf Club is currently looking for a Full Time Greenkeeper I.  Basic job duties include, but are not limited to: operation of light motorized equipment to maintain the golf course and landscape surroundings.  
	Walk mowing greens and hand raking bunkers.
	Operate rotary push mower and string line trimmer around bunker and green and tee surrounds.
	Walk mow tees and aprons. 
	Set up tee marker positions, divot repair, maintain debris in fairways using pull behind blower.
	Landscape pruning, weed and debris removal throughout property
	Hand watering
	Assist in plant material installation and care
	Clean equipment, shop interior and exterior cleaning
	Assist in renovation projects
	Employee may perform other related duties to meet the ongoing needs of the company as requested by the supervisor

Requirements:
	Previous golf course maintenance experience preferred.
	Knowledge of maintenance landscape tools helpful.
	Possession of a valid driver's license preferred.
	Ability to follow oral and written directions.
        Must be able to safely utilize hand tools and landscaping equipment.
        Able to lift and carry 50 pounds and be willing to work outdoors in a variety of weather conditions
        Prior landscaping or golf course maintenance work experience is preferred.

To get a more detailed description and apply for any of our wonderful opportunities please visit our website at www.shadycanyongolfclub.com and click on the careers link.


EOE

title: Entry Level Sales Openings - Work From Home
description:
Part time customer sales openings --  -- work with customers virtually selling our products.  There is no cost to start. Great for friendly people with or without customer experience, we will train you. Our company promotes from within, making it easy to grow with the company in a short amount of time. 


The pay starts at $22.00 base-appt.  Let me be clear on this point: that is a flat rate, not based on sales or commissions. Some conditions apply.  Unfortunately there are no benefits as this is an entry level position. Most people start with ZERO experience.  New team members always say our simple, fun training gives them all the confidence they need.  We look for people that want to improve their resume and communication skills, not just those who want to make money (we DO offer pay-raises for top performers).  Hours are 100% flexible: days/evenings/weekends/part time/& more.


We are looking for applicants who enjoy working with people, willing to learn and apply new skills. All ages eighteen and up. Those who have done well with us have had all kinds of work experience (some none at all!) - customer service; retail; office work; receptionist; sales rep; cashier; fast food; barista; stocked shelves at a supermarket; college student; server; freelance worker; intern; salesperson; babysitter or nanny; communications; administrative assistant; admin work; student work; landscaping; dog walking… Our training is so good even if an applicant has no experience at all, they can do well here. Since the position involves working with people 98.6% of students say their communication skills improve while working with us. So, even though experience isn’t necessary, we do look for people who are comfortable working with others.





Once we receive your contact information, a receptionist will send you a text to set up a time to talk with the manager. We find that this is a lot easier and faster for our applicants (since everybody always has their phones on them). We encourage applicants of all ages and experience, as we do not discriminate on the basis of an applicant’s age.

description:

Experience a plus. Opportunity for growth in company. Must be reliable, able to lift 50 lbs., have a license to drive and a reliable vehicle. 

Contact us via email, by phone or call us directly during office hours. No walk-ins. Due to the pandemic, an appropriate face mask and social distancing is required for all scheduled in-person meetings.

title: 🧹🧽 Be more than just our Custodian! 🧽🧹
description:
We are looking for a positively driven individual to join our team as our custodian to support in facility cleaning and maintenance during operational hours.  This candidate is focused on building upkeep and safety throughout our warehouse and office spaces. The ideal custodian should have the physical endurance to cover a large space. A keen eye for detail and diligence is imperative. Through the course of review by our Operations Director, the candidate may have the opportunity to be cross-trained in the cleaning and daily maintenance of our application and printing machines.

This is a temporary part-time (24-29 hrs/wk) position with the potential to grow into a full-time after 60 days.  Schedule is flexible. (Monday- Friday: 7:00am - 4:00pm)

About the company:
(Thermal ID Tech) is a rapidly growing conglomerate compromised of several divisions that provide label, packaging, print and application solutions to a wide variety of industries from food and beverage, automotive to agriculture and safety.

Your duties and responsibilities include, but not limited to:
•	Ensure spaces are prepared for the next day by taking out trash, tidying furniture and dusting and cleaning employee workstation surfaces/floors
•	Perform maintenance and minor repairs (changing light bulbs, replacing broken switches, fixing door handles, minor leaks, small plumbing issues related to sinks or restrooms, etc.)
•	Leaf blow dust/debris, and clean warehouse floor (by way of a Zamboni)
•	Maintain outer premises by dusting exterior windows, cleaning entrances and tidying up warehouse palette and dumpster areas
•	Wash and sanitize toilets, sinks and restock disposables (e.g. soap, toilet paper, paper towels, etc…)
•	Weekly disposal and cleaning of employee refrigerators 
•	Wipe mirrors and windows
•	Utilize insecticides to prevent infestation of pests
•	Report major damages to Operations Manager and oversee repairs
•	On occasion, may be tasked with moving/setting up desks for new workstations, setting up tables and chairs for in-house company lunches or in-house events
•	During downtime or department deadline oriented occasions may assist in various warehouse team-oriented tasks such as label application, jar cleaning, and/or warehouse organization

Requirements
•	Proven experience as custodian, janitor or in a similar role
•	Ability to work around machines, climb and descend ladders, operate a variety of tools and equipment, and to operate a motor vehicle
•	Hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone and/or radio
•	Frequent walking in operational areas to identify problems or hazards
•	Bend, stoop, kneel, reach, and inspect work sites. Candidates must possess the ability to lift, carry, push, and pull materials and objects weighing up to 50 pounds or heavier weights with assistance and/or the use of proper equipment.
•	Knowledge of use and maintenance of industrial cleaning equipment and appliances
•	Knowledge of safe disposal of chemical liquids and other hazardous components
•	Familiarity with basic landscaping and handyman practices is a plus
•	Attention to detail, being resourceful and aware of all surroundings as how it pertains to overall look of facility
•	Strength, stamina, and mobility to perform medium to heavy physical work
•	High school diploma is preferred but not required

At time of appointment, candidate will undergo a full background check and must have a California Driver’s License with a satisfactory driving record maintained throughout employment.

Environmental Elements
Candidates work in both indoor and outdoor environments with moderate to loud noise levels. May work in controlled temperature conditions, cold and hot temperatures, or inclement weather conditions. Exposure to chemicals, mechanical and electrical hazards, and hazardous physical substances and fumes. They will also interact with individuals in interpreting and enforcing rules, policies, and procedures.

Working Conditions
Candidates may be assigned an on-call and irregular work schedule, including weekends, early mornings, evenings, and holidays.
***This is an on-site position.***

COVID-19 considerations:
We keep a daily log of employee temperature checks, provide company-branded face masks, and sanitize our work-stations and break areas before we leave for the day.

title: Service Technician
description:
At , we understand our greatest strength is the people who choose to build a career with us.

What does it mean to be part of the Sierra Pacific family? It means you are a valued team member and part of a growing third-generation family-owned forest products company built on hard work, innovation, and wise investments.
  
With over 5,000 crew members in over 30 states, Sierra Pacific offers many opportunities for personal and professional growth; from entry-level to skilled trades, from truck drivers to sales managers, from foresters to engineers - for everyone!  We invite you to learn more about our history, our 2 million acres of forestlands, and our state-of-the-art wood product and window manufacturing facilities at .

Currently, we are seeking a qualified Service Technician to work collaboratively with our Windows division based in Irvine, CA.  


•	Diagnose and perform field repairs and provide excellent service levels 
•	This is a physical job that requires lifting, pushing/pulling, and climbing on ladders
•	Perform AAMA certified window and door installations
•	Comply with all company safety policies and procedures
•	The company will provide a service van, tools, and training
•	Meet or exceed customer’s expectations 
•	There may be some overnight travel


•	2 years’ experience in the construction / building materials industry
•	Experience servicing windows and doors, glass/glazing, and/or carpentry is preferred
•	We seek reliable, self-motivated individuals with good communication skills
•	Valid driver’s license and clean DMV record is required
•	All applicants must be at least age 18

 
Because this is more than an invitation, it's a commitment to offer opportunities for personal and professional growth to everyone! We ask people to grow with us and make the company even better.

We provide an excellent benefit package including a , and company paid Life Insurance. In addition, for over 38 years, the Sierra Pacific Foundation has provided scholarships to help the children of our crew members with education expenses. Each year, the Foundation gives an average of $500,000 in scholarships. 




Sierra Pacific Industries started in 1949 and has grown to be one of the largest lumber and millwork producers in the U.S., employing over 5,000 crew members. Sierra Pacific continues to be a company where its employees are proud to work at state-of-the-art facilities and others strive to become part of the team. 

We are a third generation family-owned company based in Northern California. Sierra Pacific owns and sustainably manages nearly 2 million acres of timberland in California and Washington. We are growing forests for our future, planting over 6 million new trees every year. Our forests are managed under a 100-year plan by Registered Professional Foresters, Wildlife Biologists, Botanists, and other professionals.

Sierra Pacific effectively uses nearly 100% of every piece of wood we bring to our facilities. In fact, any small amount that isn't turned into hand-crafted doors and windows, millwork, lumber, or landscaping material is actually converted into electricity in our seven biomass-fueled power plants. 

We are proud that all Sierra Pacific facilities follow our drug-free and tobacco-free policies. As part of our safety in the workplace policy, an offer of employment is subject to a negative drug screen result. We use E-verify to verify the social security number and work authorization of all newly hired employees. Sierra Pacific is an (EOE) Equal Opportunity Employer, including those with a disability and veterans.

Landscaper
description:
Reports to: Golf Course Maintenance Foreman / Assistant Superintendent / Golf Course 
Superintendent / Director or Golf Course Maintenance
Supervises: No supervisory duties are included in this position.

Education and/or Experience
• Some High School.
• Six months of experience in golf course grounds maintenance or greenskeeping is 
preferred.

Job Knowledge, Core Competencies and Expectations
• Knowledge of golf course operations.
• Knowledge of irrigation systems.
• Knowledge of and ability to perform required role in emergency situations.
• Cooperate with, and respect fellow employees.
• Presents a professional image at all times.
• Interest in the game of golf is preferred.

Job Summary (Essential Functions)
Maintain golf course and landscaping around the course, clubhouse and other club facilities, 
including parking lots.

Job Tasks/Duties 
• Plants and maintains ornamental shrubs, trees, and flowers.
• Performs basic labor on the golf course.
• Trims and feeds shrubs and trees; removes cuttings.
• Maintains landscape beds around clubhouse and golf course grounds.
• Rakes and blows leaves, walkways, parking lots, golf car storage areas, driveways, etc.
• Mows greens and fairways by operating walk-behind turf equipment.
• Prepares and lays sod.
• Fills divots and repairs ball marks.
• Basic operation of utility vehicles, sod cutters, weed-eaters, hand-held blowers, small 
equipment/etc.
• Rakes and edges bunkers and periodically fills with sand.2
• Loads and unloads materials.
• Repairs and maintains driving range tees.
• Cleans any/all equipment used on the golf course grounds.
• Aerifies and spikes greens.
• Digs holes and trenches to maintain or construct irrigation and drainage lines.
• Installs pipe and backfills excavations.
• Empties garbage cans.
• Attends staff meetings.
• Performs manual watering on the golf course.
• Performs other appropriate tasks as assigned by immediate supervisor.

Physical Demands and Work Environment
• Regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts and outside weather conditions.
• Frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals.
• Occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; high, precarious places; extreme 
cold; extreme heat; risk of electrical shock; and vibration. The noise level in the work 
environment is usually moderate to loud.
• Able to meet and perform the physical requirements and to work effectively in an 
environment, which is typical of this position.
• Frequent lifting, bending, climbing, stooping and pulling. 
• May need to use some protective equipment, such as a respirator, gloves, earplugs, eye 
guards/visors, boots and hat.
• Often required to get dirty and/or work in dirty environments.
• Prefer that all groundskeepers possess a valid driver’s license

title: Service Scheduler
description:
At , we understand our greatest strength is the people who choose to build a career with us.

What does it mean to be part of the Sierra Pacific family? It means you are a valued team member and part of a growing third-generation family-owned forest products company built on hard work, innovation, and wise investments.
  
With over 5,000 crew members in over 30 states, Sierra Pacific offers many opportunities for personal and professional growth; from entry-level to skilled trades, from truck drivers to sales managers, from foresters to engineers - for everyone!  We invite you to learn more about our history, our 2 million acres of forestlands, and our state-of-the-art wood product and window manufacturing facilities at .

Currently, we are seeking a qualified  to work collaboratively with our Windows division based in Irvine, CA.  


•	Answer and route incoming calls
•	Process accounts payable
•	Order service materials 
•	Write up service orders based on sales or homeowner communications
•	Facilitate communications for new clients with sales personnel
•	Scan documents into web based programs for record keeping
•	Provide warranty support on a wide variety of products
•	Communicate with customers and sales representatives, both verbally and in writing
•	Process and file service paperwork
•	Provide administrative support


•	One year prior experience in customer service and office administrative work
•	One year multi-line phone experience
•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
•	Proven ability to work well independently and in a team environment
•	Pleasant and professional telephone manner
•	Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel
•	Self-motivated, dependable, organized, and able to adapt and prioritize quickly

 
Because this is more than an invitation, it's a commitment to offer opportunities for personal and professional growth to everyone! We ask people to grow with us and make the company even better.

We provide an excellent benefit package including a , and company paid Life Insurance. In addition, for over 38 years, the Sierra Pacific Foundation has provided scholarships to help the children of our crew members with education expenses. Each year, the Foundation gives an average of $500,000 in scholarships. 




Sierra Pacific Industries started in 1949 and has grown to be one of the largest lumber and millwork producers in the U.S., employing over 5,000 crew members. Sierra Pacific continues to be a company where its employees are proud to work at state-of-the-art facilities and others strive to become part of the team. 

We are a third generation family-owned company based in Northern California. Sierra Pacific owns and sustainably manages nearly 2 million acres of timberland in California and Washington. We are growing forests for our future, planting over 6 million new trees every year. Our forests are managed under a 100-year plan by Registered Professional Foresters, Wildlife Biologists, Botanists, and other professionals.

Sierra Pacific effectively uses nearly 100% of every piece of wood we bring to our facilities. In fact, any small amount that isn't turned into hand-crafted doors and windows, millwork, lumber, or landscaping material is actually converted into electricity in our seven biomass-fueled power plants. 

We are proud that all Sierra Pacific facilities follow our drug-free and tobacco-free policies. As part of our safety in the workplace policy, an offer of employment is subject to a negative drug screen result. We use E-verify to verify the social security number and work authorization of all newly hired employees. Sierra Pacific is an (EOE) Equal Opportunity Employer, including those with a disability and veterans.

title: General Laborers Needed - Short & Long Term - Daily & Weekly Pay!!
description:

Positions available throughout Orange County - Santa Ana - Mission Viejo - San Clemente)

Our area clients have various projects of different lengths (from 1 day to long term, with some temp/hire opportunities).

These positions require the ability to perform physical labor, outdoors and/or indoors.

Construction Site Cleanup
Demolition
Moving Materials and or Equipment
Loading or Unloading Materials
Heavy Lifting
Digging & Trenching
Landscaping
General Warehouse Labor
